sources.title: The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes
sources.description: The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes stars the British Arthur Wontner, today a forgotten interpreter of Holmes who would soon be overshadowed by the glossy American productions starring the illustrious Basil Rathbone, for some people the greatest Holmes ever. Plot: Sherlock Holmes (Arthur Wontner) and Dr. Watson (Ian Fleming) come out of retirement to investigate a mysterious murder. They find that a group of coalminers, called The Scowlers, are caught up in the mystery, along with the treacherous Professor Moriarty (Lyn Harding). Holmes must outsmart Moriarity and an American gangster in order to find the murderers and save The Scowlers.

sources.title: The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes
sources.description: Title: The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes Summary: Holmes, retired to Sussex, is drawn into a last case when.arch enemy Moriarty arranges with an American gang to kill one John Douglas, a country gentleman with a mysterious past. Holmes' ... Directed by: Leslie S. Hiscott Actors: Production Company: Real Art Productions Release Date: February 1935 (UK) Aspect Ratio: 1.37 : 1 Holmes, retired to Sussex, is drawn into a last case when.arch enemy Moriarty arranges with an American gang to kill one John Douglas, a country gentleman with a mysterious past. Holmes' methods baffle Watson and Lestrade, but his results astonish them. In a long flashback, the victim's wife tells the story of the sinister Vermissa Valley.

sources.title: The Triumph of Sherlock Holmes (1935 Mystery)  Outwit an Evil Genius? A case of revenge...
sources.description:
Professor Moriarty targets a country squire, forcing Sherlock Holmes to disrupt the calculating criminal's lethal scheme. Holmes and Dr. Watson navigate traps and treachery, aiming to snare Moriarty before he vanishes again.

Director: Leslie S. Hiscott
Adapted from the novel "The Valley of Fear", by Arthur Conan Doyle
Screen writers: H. Fowler Mear & Cyril Twyford 

Main cast:
Arthur Wontner - Sherlock Holmes
Lyn Harding - Professor Moriarty
Leslie Perrins - John Douglas
Jane Carr - Ettie Douglas
Ian Fleming - Dr. John Watson
Charles Mortimer - Inspector Lestrade
Minnie Rayner - Mrs. Hudson

Genres: Mystery, Thriller, Crime
Release date: August 26, 1935 
Filming location: United Kingdom


https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL2gsu7VGzgdYp9hCsLwMx91wO9tALryNe

@CultCinemaClassics

metadata.Plot: Holmes, retired to Sussex, is drawn into a last case when arch enemy Moriarty arranges with an American gang to kill one John Douglas, a country gentleman with a mysterious past. Holmes' methods baffle Watson and Lestrade, but his results astonish them. In a long flashback, the victim's wife tells the story of the sinister Vermissa Valley.
